subject: Nutrition
title: Negative Calorie Foods
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Negative Calorie Foods.

hook.text: Celery supposedly burns more calories to digest than it contains. That's a persistent myth.

buildup.text: The idea is that some foods need more energy to digest than they provide, creating a calorie deficit.

discovery.text: Celery has 6 calories per stalk. Your body uses about half a calorie to digest it. The math fails.

twist.text: No food has a negative calorie balance. Even ice waterâ€”which your body must warmâ€”burns about 1 calorie per glass.

climax.text: Low-calorie vegetables are healthy for many reasons, but negative calories isn't one of them.

punchline.text: Eating celery burns calories. Just not that many.

quiz.question: How many calories does it take to digest a stalk of celery?
